Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Initial Propofol Bolus Doses in Different TCI Pumps

Intervention.evidence: Two pumps employed a fixed equilibration rate constant (ke0) of 0.456 min−1, while the other two used a fixed time to peak concentration (tpeak) of 1.6 min.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to investigate whether differences exist in the initial bolus dose between different TCI pumps, despite using the same pharmacokinetic (PK) model.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the propofol bolus dose, measured on a high precision scale.

Result_Outcome.evidence: For instance, a virtual 60-year-old, obese man received 72.0 ± 1.0 mg with a Perfusor Space pump and 111.9 ± 1.2 mg with an Alaris pump (P < 0.001).
